content.text: Learn how to create a menu icon with CSS.
content.html: Learn how to create a menu icon with CSS.

content.text: How To Create a Menu Icon
If you are not using an icon library, you can create a basic menu icon with CSS:
content.html: If you are not using an icon library, you can create a basic menu icon with CSS:

content.code_html:
<div></div>
<div></div>
<div></div>

syntaxHighlighting.text:
div {  width: 35px;  height: 5px;  
background-color: black;  margin: 6px 0;}

content.code:
div {  width: 35px;  height: 5px;
background-color: black;  margin: 6px 0;}

syntax_highlighting.text:
div {  width: 35px;  height: 5px;  
background-color: black;  margin: 6px 0;}

content.code_html:
div {
  width: 35px;
  height: 5px;
  background-color: black;
  margin: 6px 0;
}

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
div {  width: 35px;  height: 5px;  
background-color: black;  margin: 6px 0;}

content.text: The width and the height property specifies the width and height of each bar.
content.html: The width and the height property specifies the width and height of each bar.

content.text: We have added a black background-color , and the top and bottom margin is used to create some distance between each bar.
content.html: We have added a black background-color, and the top and bottom margin is used to create some distance between each bar.

content.text: Use CSS and JavaScript to change the menu icon to a "cancel/remove" icon when it is clicked on:
content.html: Use CSS and JavaScript to change the menu icon to a "cancel/remove" icon when it is clicked on:

content.code_html:
<div class="container" onclick="myFunction(this)">
  <div class="bar1"></div>
  <div class="bar2"></div>
  <div class="bar3"></div>
</div>

.container {
  display: inline-block;
  cursor: pointer;
}

.bar1, .bar2, .bar3 {
  width: 35px;
  height: 5px;
  background-color: #333;
  margin: 6px 0;
  transition: 0.4s;
}

/* Rotate first bar */
.change .bar1 {
  transform: translate(0, 11px) rotate(-45deg);
}

/* Fade out the second bar */
.change .bar2 {opacity: 0;}

/* Rotate last bar */
.change .bar3 {
  transform: translate(0, -11px) rotate(45deg);
}

function myFunction(x) {
  x.classList.toggle("change");
}

content.text: HTML & CSS: We use the same styles as before, only this time, we wrap a container element around each <div> element and we specify a class name for each.
content.html: HTML & CSS: We use the same styles as before, only this time, we wrap a container element around each <div> element and we specify a class name for each.

content.text: The container element is used to show a pointer symbol when the user moves the mouse over the divs (bars). When it is clicked on, it will execute a JavaScript function that adds a new class name to it, which will change the styles of each horizontal bar: the first and the last bar is transformed and rotated to the letter "x". The bar in the middle fades out and becomes invisible.
content.html: The container element is used to show a pointer symbol when the user moves the mouse over the divs (bars). When it is clicked on, it will execute a JavaScript function that adds a new class name to it, which will change the styles of each horizontal bar: the first and the last bar is transformed and rotated to the letter "x". The bar in the middle fades out and becomes invisible.
